intro: Camissonia wigginsii, commonly known as Wiggins' camissonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the flowering plant family Camissoniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, small white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
